description: Borrowed from Latin lūxuriātus, from lūxuriō.

verbs.description: luxuriate (third-person singular simple present luxuriates, present participle luxuriating, simple past and past participle luxuriated)

examples: Luxuriate in the wonderful service of our five-star hotel.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To be luxuriant; to grow exuberantly.
